page.title: 05Entertainment in B. Monkton
page.content:
There is a Bishop Monkton { {Entertainments Group } of which everyone living in the village is deemed to be a member. This group produces a play every October, a Summer show, and a Pantomime each February. These take place in the Women's Institute Hall, and are seen by audiences of at least 400.
In the pantomime every village child wishing to perform is included in the cast, as well as many adult performers, and the number involved is usually about 50-60.
Occasional entertainments take place, including fireworks displays and Carol singing around the village at Christmas time.
